eshmun.gui.utils.models.skeleton

Class SkeletonTransition

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.gui.utils.models.skeleton.SkeletonTransition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SkeletonTransition
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represent a guarded transition between two states in a Synchronization Skeleton.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • SkeletonTransition

        public SkeletonTransition(SkeletonState from,
                          SkeletonState to,
                          GuardExpression guard)
        Creates a new Transition.
        Parameters:
        guard - the guard.
        from - the start state.
        to - the end state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the command syntax is wrong.

    • Method Detail

      • readResolve

        private java.lang.Object readResolve()
        Ensures the transient guardExpression is loaded from the guard String.
        Returns:
        this with the guardExpression field parsed.

      • getGuard

        public GuardExpression getGuard()
        Gets the guard, with OR and AND written as |, &.
        Returns:
        the guard.

      • setGuard

        public void setGuard(GuardExpression guard)
        Sets the guard.
        Parameters:
        guard - the guard with OR and AND written as |, &.

      • getTo

        public SkeletonState getTo()
        Gets the end state.
        Returns:
        the end state.

      • update

        public void update(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Updates the radius of the state according to size of the label.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics used to draw.

      • isBackwards

        public boolean isBackwards()
        Checks if this transition is going backwards or forward.
        Returns:
        true if it is backwards, false otherwise.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws this transition into the given graphics.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics in which the transition will be drawn.

      • breakGuard

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> breakGuard(int width,
                                                    java.lang.String guardFragement,
                                                    java.awt.Graphics g)
        Breaks the guard into separate lines when needed, the breaking is done as close as possible to the center of the line.
        Parameters:
        width - the width possible to use.
        guardFragement - the piece of the guard to line-break.
        g - the graphics used to draw.
        Returns:
        the breaks as a list.

      • getSelectPoints

        public java.awt.Point[] getSelectPoints()
        Returns two points on the Perpendicular Bisector of the main segment, useful in drawing blue circles around the main segment when selected.

        These two points are equal in distance to the main segment (5 pixels), The pixels are ordered from the least y to the biggest y.

        Returns:
        the two points.

      • getPeaks

        public int[] getPeaks()
        Gets the maximum and the minimum Y on this segment, in order.
        Returns:
        the maximum and the minimum Y.

      • edit

        public boolean edit()
        Shows an edit dialog to edit the content of the transition.
        Returns:
        true of the transition was changed, false otherwise.

      • copy

        public SkeletonTransition copy(SkeletonState from,
                               SkeletonState to)
        Copies this transition into an identical state.
        Parameters:
        from - the from state.
        to - the to state.
        Returns:
        a copy of this state.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.Point p)
        Checks if a point is contained on this transition (to some epsilon).
        Parameters:
        p - the point to check.
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the transition, false otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks if two transitions are equal (equal from and to).
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to check equality with.
        Returns:
        true if both objects have equal from and to states, command and guard are disregarded.

      • canBreakCharacter

        private boolean canBreakCharacter(char c)
        Parameters:
        c - the character to check.
        Returns:
        true if the character is an operator or white space (it is safe to break here) false otherwise.
